website_summaries.verdict: Six-sided fidget cube with multiple fidgeting options and a lifetime warranty.
pros: Great release toy for children and adults, especially those with extra energy, ADD, ADHD, OCD, autism, or high stress/anxiety levels
Has six sides so users can click, roll, spin, flip, glide, and breathe.Made with high-quality ABS plastic and silicone
cons: Some complaints that it makes too much noise or wasn't what buyers expected

customer_reviews.title: Very durable and works well for kids who need something to "fidget" with.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for one of my student's who needed something to fidget with during class. I am a special education teacher and I know many of my kids need something to fidget with in order to stay focused in class. My student LOVED this fidget cube and she was able to stay focused in class longer. I want to buy more, but the price keeps me waiting until the price comes down.
customer_reviews.author: FR_Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Great for ADHD, autism, or anyone who fidgets!
customer_reviews.text: When my grandson opened the box, his eyes got huge and an enormous grin shone! He had used someone else's and didn't want to give it back. There is minimal noise. It might work in a pocket in a classroom or work environment, but may be noticed by others. It's perfect for home use.
customer_reviews.author: J.R.

customer_reviews.title: Great for anxiety!
customer_reviews.text: I take this with me nearly everywhere! It is great for people with severe anxiety who need the extra help being in social settings. Serves is purpose and truly relaxing
customer_reviews.author: Selena Collazo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for fidgety clients
customer_reviews.text: This Fidget Cube has turned out to be the perfect addition to the basket of "fidget toys" I keep in my counseling office. Clients of all ages like exploring the various sides of the Fidget Cube, and it keeps their restless fingers occupied while they discuss stressful topics during therapy sessions. The Cube is also easy to sanitize with an antibacterial wipe between clients.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget
customer_reviews.text: My son loved this. He is has sensory issues and played with this until he fell asleep. Though some of the gadgets on there are noisy so it also accommodates kids that like noise to help them relax but maybe not parents and teachers. But not too noisy to the point where it's like very super distracting
customer_reviews.author: heidi

customer_reviews.title: Low cost, high build quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a gift for a friend; I kind of expected it to be junk, due to the price, but I was pleasantly surprised! This cube seems to be very well made. It has several different types of fidget activities, each giving a different tactile experience. You have buttons that click, buttons that squish, knobs, thumb stick, spinner, and a clicking switch. The only complaint I've heard is the desire for some of the knobs to click. However, this doesn't seem to be a huge deal breaker, as they really enjoy using it. In fact, I ordered one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: Dan the Wizard

customer_reviews.title: Best one
customer_reviews.text: There are many fidget cubes on the market, but this one is just perfect in terms of size, low noise and variety of knobs and things. Is is a very discreet way to relieve stress and anxiety at work or in college. It is quite sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.author: N. Defontnouvelle

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly and item is exactly as described. It was an early Christmas present for my husband who has high anxiety and always clicks pens. He loved the different sides to this cube. Would whole heartedly recommend to anyone who fidgets.
customer_reviews.author: C. Watts

customer_reviews.title: perfect for fidgeting
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the best. I have somewhat frustrating anxiety and constantly fidget when I'm not using my hands. I usually touch my hair or my face, and this is a really nice alternative to doing that. The bottom side of the cube is rubber and makes it easy to grip the cube in any position you're holding it in. The switch does make a slight clicking noise, so it can be a little noisy, but the rest of the cube sides are quieter and could be used in a quiet area. Overall, I love it. I got it today and almost immediately began writing this review. It's awesome. You won't regret this purchase. - Liz
customer_reviews.author: Jay Whaley

customer_reviews.title: Much better than store bought cubes
customer_reviews.text: I received the fidget cube very quickly and it was just a promised. It came in a nice box that I can use as a gift box for my daughter that wants it for Christmas. The fidget cube is actually better than one I found in the store for my son. She will be so excited to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: great little toy, bit noisy
customer_reviews.text: was a bit bigger than I expected (was expecting something the size of a large die), it's about an inch, inch-and-a-half cube, works very well, little noisy for something like church though (I do tech support for a living, and need something to keep my hands busy when I'm just waiting around that wont bug the customers, this was just noisy enough that I didn't feel comfortable doing that with this fidget toy) still, even the noise is very satisfying, just not for quiet situations
customer_reviews.author: Brandon H.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it... cheaply made and breaks within minutes
customer_reviews.text: Plastic parts seem really cheaply made and the switch side does not work. Click it one time and now it won't click to the other side. What a waste. I picked this one since it was more expensive it seemed to be promising but nope.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandria Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this to be such great quality and was skeptical until the moment I opened the box. I was very pleasantly surprised at how well made it is, nothing about it feels cheap which was my biggest concern. Every face is well made and uses durable materials that have lasted over months of use and wear. Highly recommend if you want a great fidget cube!
customer_reviews.author: MC2

customer_reviews.title: You can fidget, but people will hear it.
customer_reviews.text: This fidget cube while it has decent quality and seems to be holding up, is not an ideal fidget as it is loud and can't be easily concealed. Even the rotating circle is loud enough for people nearby to hear it. If you want a fidget that you can mess with that will annoy everyone around you, this is the fidget for you! If you don't want to disturb your coworkers and loved ones, I suggest finding another fidget.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey L.

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: The spinner fell off before we even had a chance to use it. Now one side has a sharp spindle sticking out.
customer_reviews.author: roseystoney

customer_reviews.title: Fragile
customer_reviews.text: I fidget constantly, so this thing should be a dream for me. However, after a day of use, the joystick won't stay attached any longer. There's a magnet in there that holds it in, but it only takes a little force - like moving it to the side - for the joystick to come out.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Andrew Smith

customer_reviews.title: Failed Fidget Cube - Broken and Useless.
customer_reviews.text: This item broke after being used by myself after using it daily. I am extremely disappointed in this cube. I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Two Russians and Three Chinchillas.

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. Don’t waste you money
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if this is any different than the 50 other brands of this fidget cube but I can say this one is terrible. Pretty much every side has some sort of flaw. I’ve included a short video. The joystick is off-center. The 2-position switch barely has any spring tension and is squeaky. The 2 non-click buttons out of the 4 are way too squishy and get stuck down sometimes. The 3 gears don’t have any detent and just spin freely (but may be designed this way). The circular spinner is cheapo plastic and fits loosely. Every side is just bad.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Wears Out Extremely Fast
customer_reviews.text: After one day of use, my fidget cube started making obnoxious squeaking sounds when using the switch and the stick portions of it. After a second day, the thumbstick stopped returning to it's default position on it's own. Being noisy and feeling broken makes this uncomfortable to use, especially considering how the sounds of the squeaking distract and irritate others around me in an office environment. I do not recommend this. It looks nice but it's very low quality.
customer_reviews.author: Lily

customer_reviews.title: Broken switch... cheap
customer_reviews.text: Delivered.. the switch is stuck so now I am stuck trying to force this switch work
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my hands busy
customer_reviews.text: I have, I guess, smallish hands, and the Fidget Cube fits comfortably. Each side of the cube has a different gizmo to toggle, click, spin, rotate, a texture to rub, and a little joystick. Some of the doohickeys make a soft clicking sound, so if you’re in class or someplace that the clicks might be heard, there are enough choices on the cube for silent fidgeting. I'm ADHD and if I’m not fidgeting with something, I’m picking at my cuticles. This little cube is a good substitute.
customer_reviews.author: Myra J.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is way too big and just not fun or easy to use. I’ll be sticking with my fidget spinners.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I really liked it for the first few days. It helped me keep my free hand busy when I was working on schoolwork or drawing. But after that, the joystick kind of started to jam and mess up before it broke. However, when I contacted the seller and explained the issue, they immediately sent a new one free of charge. Very helpful and professional. Update: The joystick jammed again. This seems to be a design issue, not an individual item defect.
customer_reviews.author: CalyD

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed, and it's noisy
customer_reviews.text: Materials used are cheap and flimsy. Also, some of the activities make a clicking noise when you play with it, even gently. I bought it for my son to use in class when he's restless to help him focus. The fact that it's noisy defeats the purpose of why I bought it....it's too distracting for a classroom, meeting, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Benny

customer_reviews.title: Feels like a Beta Tester
customer_reviews.text: Very Fragile, Buttons vere not as snappy as i thought. The light switch style snapper felt flimsy, sometimes activated by just a slight touch. The gears turned very easily and skipped their groove very frequently. The joy stick was my second favorite, until it popped upwards and downwards and the internals/spring was exposed. The most satisfying and clickable side for me would be the four little buttons side, which only 2 of the buttons had a click. Esthetically it is very pleasing in the hand. The color scheme is very well balanced. Wish I could refer this, but i can't. lasted just over 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: Final Product

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.  Pretty fun while at the office.
customer_reviews.text: Something to play with at work. The little "light-switch" side was kind of broken I guess as it would get "crunchy" when flipping it in one direction. At first, I just assumed that it was normal. However, I accidentally dropped it at work the other day and it seemed to fix itself and clicks smoothly in both directions now. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Even more cheaply made than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect this to be super heavy duty, but it was junk. One of the little dials lasted about 90 seconds before it lost all resistance. Other parts barely felt like they moved. If it had at least been fun for a couple of days, I may not have cared. This was boring from the start and doesn't last.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my hands busy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fidget cube because for most of my life I have struggled to keep my hands still. Without thinking, I'll tear at my lips and the cuticles of my fingers. It's just an anxious habit I've always had. So far this fidget cube has really helped keep my hands occupied during presentations and other moments where my mind is engaged but my hands normally wouldn't be. It really helped me a lot yesterday in particular. It comes with a nice variety of things to do, some of which don't cause any audible sounds, which is helpful during quieter group gatherings like work meetings.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine Clarke

customer_reviews.title: Great to fidget, but the joystick sucks.
customer_reviews.text: It's great for the first few days, my favorite part was the joystick, which is where the downside of this cube is. Within a few days of use, the joystick gets super stiff and annoying to play with. After about a month and replacing it 3 times (totally lost the other ones), I grew bored of it. I'd give it 5 stars if the joystick was more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn I.

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Get it if you Deal with Chronic Anxiety Like me!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I played with one for the first time at my psychiatrists office and knew I had to have one. I'm only giving 4/5 instead of 5/5 because the joy stick part came off with a not so strong pull. While I was able to reattach it without issue, it makes an annoying squeaky noise now. Otherwise, It's fantastic and I strongly recommend for those with anxiety, or people on the spectrum.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 10-year-old. He requested it, I had never heard of it. He likes all the functions and motions on it but prefers the switch which does make an audible click. It’s great for those who need it but for those around them it is audible. It doesn’t bother me, But there are sounds.
customer_reviews.author: hilary w clauss

customer_reviews.title: Great for online school!
customer_reviews.text: I've been finding myself getting super distracted lately with a bunch of online calls but this little guy has been really helping! It's great because of reaching for my phone or something like that I just reach for the cube which helps me concentrate.
customer_reviews.author: Nabila Eve

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: This is ultimately what I expected however the construction isn't great. As a fidgeter, I like to use something to keep me focused, however this thing is SO LOUD!!!! I feel like every time I pick it up, the entire office can hear me fidgeting. This point is for this to be discreet. I don't use it much at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Great fidget
customer_reviews.text: Our teenage daughter has anxiety and Trichotillomania (a disorder on the OCD spectrum that manifests in compulsively pulling out her own hair, strand by strand) and we are always looking for “fidgets” to keep her hands busy and out of her hair. She picked this one out and likes it so much we bought a second. She keeps one in her backpack for school and one at the dinner table. It’s quiet and small enough to be discreet, and provides multiple different sensations.
customer_reviews.author: KJ

customer_reviews.title: Overall a nice little fidget device
customer_reviews.text: Overall I do like this cube. It keeps my hands busy and mind more focused. I do wish the "click" button was a touch more responsive - I really like to go fast when I'm nervous. Also nice: none of the fidget thingies make much noise, so if you're fidgeting in public no one has to know.
customer_reviews.author: CA Davis

customer_reviews.title: refocuses a wandering mind
customer_reviews.text: This fidget cube does a great job of preventing the mind from wandering off, allowing one to better focus. The only thing I would change is smoothing the flat side to be more like a worry stone, rather than the bumpy surface it is.
customer_reviews.author: Hope Jacquet

customer_reviews.title: Noisey
customer_reviews.text: Item just like picture. The only complaint is each of the fidget sides makes noise/clicks. My purchase was for a teen with ADHD and it may get annoying to teachers or classmates to constantly hear clicking. (Sounds similar to clicking a ballpoint pen). Other than that it’s cool.
customer_reviews.author: LADYSIP

customer_reviews.title: Relieved step mom approved
customer_reviews.text: My step daughter has ocd. She has a fidget cube but she lost it at our house one weekend before returning to her mother's and was very stressed out about it. I ordered this product and shipped it to her at her mothers address. It arrived within 3 days and she has been using it since. Thank you so much.
customer_reviews.author: Beki

customer_reviews.title: Great to keep you occupied
customer_reviews.text: This is great to help with my anxiety- mostly at school or the office. Outside of that, I don’t find use for it. It’s great though, almost completely silent. The side for the 4 buttons, 2/4 make a click noise- similar to the light switch side sound.
customer_reviews.author: Tara

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for anxiety
customer_reviews.text: Gave this to brother since he suffers a lot from anxiety as a way to alleviate. After a few weeks, I notice that he was carrying this with him almost everywhere. It certainly help him and quality of the product is good.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe

customer_reviews.title: Great white elephant gift for the easily distracted
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the family white elephant gift - we have a lot of fidgeters. It didn’t get stolen, but multiple family members enjoyed passing it around afterward and said it would be nice to have. There are noisy and quiet options on the same cube. We will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Dhughes

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality
customer_reviews.text: My son is 10 and I got him this for Christmas. It has been one month and two of the pieces have already broken. He doesn't use it very much, so its been frustrating. One of the fidget designs was so difficult to use, my husband and I had a hard time moving it. I wouldn't recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought other fidget cubes in the past that were too small. This one is a perfect size for adult hands. It definite offers plenty of options to play with to find what’s most satisfying for you. My son has now taken it because he loved it so much so I’ll be buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Boykin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: It makes a rusty sound and the switch gets stuck sometimes. This can be annoying for someone with ADHD that wants to use it a lot nonstop. For $10 I expect more. They need to lower the price on this, it’s more like $3 quality ones
customer_reviews.author: Darlene Cordova

customer_reviews.title: Price is distracting
customer_reviews.text: A nice stocking filler gift and all the parts on the cube you get to play with are sturdily built but it’s just not worth the price when you consider a cheap clickly pen will do the same job for a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: My Truck Camper

customer_reviews.title: Too many gadgets for a fidgeter
customer_reviews.text: My son is a “fidgiter”. I get him these kinds of things a lot bc he loses them. This one however he says has TOO many things to do. You have to think about what you are doing.
customer_reviews.author: Pearland Terp

customer_reviews.title: Joy Stick
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately for me I may have received the bad one from the batch. On the 1st day I started to use the cube the joystick started to get stuck on me and it would not rotate smoothly. It sounds and feels as if I need to use WD-40 and it does not feel great. If anything it makes me even more stressed (joking!) I don’t like to write bad reviews but this item did not meet my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Chaidez

customer_reviews.title: It was great until the joystick messed up
customer_reviews.text: The joystick part of mine started squeaking and feels real scrubby like something is messed up inside of it. This happened after only 2 weeks of owning it and not a whole lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Seems Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: Seems pretty cheaply made. Hope my daughter still likes it. The worry stone seems like a waste to me. I don’t know if the four little buttons are all supposed to make noise or not, but only two of them do. I’d pick a different one if I had it to do over again.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Evilsizor

customer_reviews.title: Squeaky Success
customer_reviews.text: When I realized I couldn't even pay attention to a Netflix show because I needed something to do with my hands and kept ending up on my phone, I knew I needed something to change the habit. The fidget cube has done just that and been a great change to keep me more focused. My only complaint is that two of the functions, the switch and the toggle at the top, are VERY squeaky- to the point where I avoid using them. Overall worth the buy, but beware of the annoying squeak especially in public!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Anxiety Relief
customer_reviews.text: I love this product. Purchased it to help control my anxiety and OCD tendencies. It is small enough to keep in my pocket, purse or cup holder. I’d buy a 5 pack if offered. Helped me stop biting my nails completely.
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely Sydney Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Relieves tension, annoying sound.
customer_reviews.text: This has helped me stop mindlessly scrolling through my phone. And helps relieve some of my nervous energy. But the switch makes a terrible squeaking sound. It is very unpleasant. Other than that I love it. But I've ordered a different one because that sound is just plain annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: Some of the materials could have been better.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the edges are rounded off, allowing it to fit in my hand more naturally than an actual cube. The body of the cube has a nice feel and is quite durable over all. However, the sides that have a hard plastic component feel cheaply made and the "light switch" side has an annoying high pitch when pushed up against. There's also a noticeable gap where the two halves of the shell come together. Isn't bad, but was definitely made with some cheap parts and not QC'ed.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Love this! Just right for my fidgety fingers. Lots of different tactile things- switches, buttons, dials. Very good sturdy quality. Came in a very nice box too!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn E.

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this for myself and I really enjoyed it for the three weeks I had it. Then, one of my students stole it. As long as it helps reduce his stress. Then I know it was worth the buy. I would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: Solid fidget cube
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my sister, and she loves it. It's got a good feel and fits nicely in the palm of your hands. The buttons feel a little cheap but overall its a good fidget cube.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Durkee

customer_reviews.title: Just as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It keeps busy hands busy. If it were a little bit more quiet it would be perfect. fits easily in small boys pocket so he can fuss with it.
customer_reviews.author: michael hart

customer_reviews.title: Great for Focusing
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying my Fidget Cube. Having this in my hand while I am in class really helps me to keep from getting distracted with my phone and other things. By fidgeting with the cube, my mind is able to stay focused. Though the toggle (joy) stick quit snapping back after about a week, all the other clickers and switches are working great and it still accomplishes the task.
customer_reviews.author: James Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great fidgit cube
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my ADHD son and he loves it. It keeps him occupied while in class and the teachers have never had an issue with him having it. I do recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tasha M.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: this was awesome, gave it as a gift to a friend who fidgets a lot. I had previously bought a different brand fidget cube which broke easily, this one did not
customer_reviews.author: Infamous

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: The cube works great for a few days and then it starts breaking down. The joy stick is unusable after an hour or two of use. The switches don’t have the most satisfying clicks, and not of it feels real sturdy. But it was less than $10 and kept my hands busy for a week or two before I completely stopped using it. The package it comes in is pretty cool, but the product inside is a bit of a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: Gave it to my daughter who has anxiety. It has helped her. Very small and she can put it in her pocket and use it as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Reese

customer_reviews.title: Something else to occupy my kids
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know and kinda don’t care what all of this is about. I just know that it worked as stocking stuffers and my kids weren’t mad about them.
customer_reviews.author: lady of the house

customer_reviews.title: Still new, time will tell.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for autistic grandson. He constantly shreds things, his clothes, towels., etc. So, I'm hopeful this gadget will replace the need to shred, but still allow him the outlet to fidget with his hands. It's only been a few days, I am optimistic.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie from FL

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: it’s pretty good for the price... the joy stick part became squeaky but everything else is pretty good:) great for my ptsd it distracts me during episodes and it’s great for regular anxiety don’t recommend for add or adhd it’s more of a distraction
customer_reviews.author: E.Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Wears out  :\
customer_reviews.text: Like this product but the 3 wheels wear out quickly and the rough textured rubber pad comes off with use - still like it though
customer_reviews.author: Zoie Trevino

customer_reviews.title: Good gift
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son, bc his fingers are always so fidgetty and bc he bites his nails. He likes it. Works well for what I got it for. He is 8 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bottjer

customer_reviews.title: Great for in class.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve only had it for a few months now, so I can’t judge it’s durability, but it’s great for when you need something to fidget with in class. It’s a bit loud in a silent classroom, but there are also silent buttons. So I just use those.
customer_reviews.author: Janet

customer_reviews.title: Definitely reccomend
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this fidget cube. It definitely helps when I'm having a panic or anxiety attack or when I'm just feeling nervous.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: This product has stood the test of high volume use and is still holding up well! It does everything it says it should and really feels like a high quality product! My kids love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy

customer_reviews.title: Great while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: My son got this in his stocking Christmas morning, and lost it by the end of the day in my moms back yard. He really loved it while he had it though!
customer_reviews.author: KoontzFan

customer_reviews.title: Fun little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these, one for myself and one for my daughter. They’re full of surprises and mindless fidgeting for when you need to keep your hands busy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quit working
customer_reviews.text: The switch on it quit working after only 10 minutes. It got stuck. And I was handling it carefully. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: HTH

customer_reviews.title: My 15 year old grandson loved it.
customer_reviews.text: he fidgets ALL the time. He laughed when he opened it and started clicking away. He carries it with him to keep his fingers busy and drive his friends crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fidget
customer_reviews.text: It's alright! Might get a little boring after awhile, but it does the trick if you just need something to fidget with.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Big fidget cube
customer_reviews.text: I love fidget cubes. This one is a bit big but it makes it less likely that me or my daughter will lose it.
customer_reviews.author: butterphly

customer_reviews.title: Just ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok... it’s not as “sturdy” I expected so one doesn’t get the feeling they are actually clicking a switch... the rolling things are quite sloppy too.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Came broken
customer_reviews.text: Came broken, seems extremely cheap and not durable. Also makes too much noise, almost seems like a baby you
customer_reviews.author: Frankie

customer_reviews.title: Feels cheap
customer_reviews.text: I'm a little disappointed. Compared to my friend's that I tried, this one feels cheap, doesn't run smooth (the three wheels and the one spinning dial), and just does less overall. I bought this one because I liked the rounded edges, but I wish I bought one in a store so I could hold it first.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, might not be for very severe fidgeters
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really great! It has helped tremendously with my skin picking disorder. The pictured top part (the swirling knob) had very quickly gotten a bit stuck, but it works fine and I even like the slight resistance. It's dependable for the price. For people who have very severe anxiety and fidget very roughly, this might break sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle

customer_reviews.title: Completely portable.
customer_reviews.text: Grandson asked for as a gift. Was a hit, he loves it. Has in his pocket for relief of stress...
customer_reviews.author: jkinshella

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: This is great, it’s helps with my anxiety out in public! I dropped it once and it didn’t break!
customer_reviews.author: jessica

customer_reviews.title: Good, not durable...
customer_reviews.text: Was a great product initially, and was happy to receive. Joystick however quickly became prone to sticking after less than a week of light use, along with making a squeaky noise. In hindsight, I would've gone with an alternative product.
customer_reviews.author: CyclonX

customer_reviews.title: Overall pretty disappointing
customer_reviews.text: I'll list the cube's 6 sides in order of how nice the tactile feedback is light switch: Nice, it clicks into place which is satisfying Joystick: Good to move but doesn't click when you press in spinny face: Its okay, you can also press it 4 buttons: Half of them don't click when you press them which is disappointing empty face: Its empty 3 dials: I was looking for the feeling of playing with a lock but there's no resistance at all.
customer_reviews.author: C__

customer_reviews.title: My kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Durable and the kids really like it. Don't know if they could take to school as a couple of buttons make a clicking noise.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who fidgets
customer_reviews.text: I have extreme anxiety and get very restless. This helps avoid a lot of the hand wringing and leg bouncing.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Lee

customer_reviews.title: decent.
customer_reviews.text: this fidget "cube" is decent build quality. the switch is like meh but better then the fidget 12 sided one. does not feel well in my hand and just feels meh in general. dont buy if you have the antsy labs fidget cube. that1fidgeter (written by a 10 year old with no focusing issues)
customer_reviews.author: Cyclic

customer_reviews.title: Terrible cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Shattered after a 4 ft drop onto pavement. Thought this would be a gun gag gift, wound up being only a gag
customer_reviews.author: Alex S

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been using mine for a couple years now. I put a microscopic drop of WD-40 down into the inner workings when I got it and it improved the feel and prevented the occasional squeak noise from the switch mechanism. I've put a lot of miles on mine and it is still in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Kendall Payne

customer_reviews.title: Worth 25 cents in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Looks like they're trying to Bank off the "Fidget" names. Looked and felt and was about as useful as something I would expect to get out of a quarter gumball machine. For ten bucks I expected a lot more than this. I probably wouldn't pay a dollar at the Dollar tree for this. Cheap little plastic that does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Carnahan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the dollars and relief
customer_reviews.text: This has made riding the bus easier for me and in high stress situations. It doesn’t always work but when it does...
customer_reviews.author: Mare

customer_reviews.title: Fun thingy
customer_reviews.text: Neat little cube. I wish the scroll wheels were bigger. All the buttons are great. The surface is nice to the touch too. I got it to help with nail biting.
customer_reviews.author: NY rat

customer_reviews.title: Works, but is loud
customer_reviews.text: The different fidget sections of this toy are really satisfying for keeping my hands moving. However, the components were very loud, with the exception of the video game toggle side. This made it impractical for me to use in public. I've been using it while doing work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for son
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this and says it’s helping him focus. Good quality and durable.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne D

customer_reviews.title: figit cube
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needs something to figit with and she loves this, it has really helped, she takes it to school and it's great!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Goocher

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift, was well received, 13 year old, she loved it.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Broke pretty quick
customer_reviews.text: One of the parts broke about about a month. Granted we got some use out of it but it wasn’t used often at all in that month.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Even good to start a conversation
customer_reviews.text: This item has been a life saver on work, college, at home waiting for games to download, at boring family reunions, and when people see it it becomes a subject of conversation.
customer_reviews.author: Ayano

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I am not diagnosed with anything but I have a hard time concentrating on only one thing. I use this cube to concentrate and it has been helping. I use it in class and some of the fidget options are silent so I use those not to distract others.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Kohan

customer_reviews.title: helps focus
customer_reviews.text: I like the being able to use fingers in a exercise routine while on the computer reviewing my work.
customer_reviews.author: Rawland S.

product_meta.title: Helect H1037 Fidget Cube Toy Relieves Stress and Anxiety
feature_bullets: Helect Fidget Cube Designed to improve a sense of calm, reduce stress and anxiety, develop focus and concentration, and promote comfort and relaxation with various features
Suitable for children and adults, especially for those with extra energy, ADD&ADHD, OCD, autism, or high stress / anxiety levels
Featuring 6 sides for you to click, roll, spin, flip, glide and breathe
Made with high-quality ABS plastic and silicone, standing up to everyday fidgeting wear and tear
Package includes: 1 x Fidget Cube, customer service card

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,041 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
